snippet: A federal judge rightly challenges the government’s authority to detain individuals indefinitely, while Congress renews unneeded spying powers.
abstract: Editorial criticizes the House for granting a five year extension to the Fisa Amendments Act, 2008 law that expanded the government's power to conduct surveillance on citizens without warrants; also criticizes federal judge Katherine Forrest for her broad and permanent enjoinment of a 2011 provision that codified the president's authority to detain individuals indefinitely.
lead_paragraph: A federal judge rightly challenges the government’s authority to detain individuals indefinitely, while Congress renews unneeded spying powers.
